body: Another interesting tidbit: The issue repros in webpack: 5.0.0-beta.31 and after, but not 5.0.0-beta.30 and before.
Doing npm installs of the commits that were new to beta.31, will report back soon with the commit that breaks this scenario

Does not repro with commit 23e91dbbac9d8fc98b9a87e8822b711be5634fc6
Does repro with commit 9af1d7526b180cab69ea175175eb56a2cde9df75

Looks like it was introduced in this commit: https://github.com/webpack/webpack/commit/9af1d7526b180cab69ea175175eb56a2cde9df75
Ok, I found the problem and have a bugfix. Still need to construct a smaller test case to add it to our test suite...

issue.title: fixes unused export bug

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

body: Thank you for taking the time to fix this so quickly. I've made a donation to webpack as a small thank you for the bug fix and all the other awesome work the team has done on the project.

body: (note: deleted my comments, I think perhaps output.libraryTarget default might have changed, but explicitly setting to UMD preserved the exports.)
